title: (x) Brendel Informatik's Plakette - based on Permanent {Mike F}
content:
"plakette" shareware font by Brendel Informatik is on what commercial font.   
 ![plakette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69808.jpg)
author: designalchemy

comments.content:
Similar to [House Gothic Condensed Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=15&subpage=viewfonts)   
   
which are very [popular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69811.html?1113531248) this evening.

' [Compacta](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=Compacta)' and ' [Europa Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.roostertypes.com/prod_display.asp?group_id=EurGro)' would be close, as well..

Brendel Informatik, I have come to learn, digitized quite a few typefaces that are otherwise unavailable digitally. I think that Plakette is a digitization of the Permanent typeface family (the g and, especially, the y are quite distinctive). This is Plakette DemiBold:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69878.gif)   
   
Using and stretching this, I was able to duplicate your 'panic' image.   
   
Permanent originally came in more than one weight and [Brendel](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.qbf.de/tceng.htm) offers Plakette in five. The only other digital version of Permenent I'm aware of is [URW's](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415052043/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/permanent/). Pre-digital Permanent also used to be offered in versions with and without descenders. URW's offering matches Plakette DemiBold, except that it is without descenders while Plakette is with descenders.
